rComments: The course material is not hard but you have to do the learning yourself. The teacher and the lecture are useless and unhelpful. I feel like this course is a self-teaching course. If you are interested in religion, just borrow the textbook from library and study on your own. You cannot get anything from the teacher or the lecture.

This course is so boring. I watch drama in class. He makes me hate studying religion. To be fair, he is a good person but I am not sure about his teaching... His exams are totally memorization. If you have an incredible good memory, this course is for you. You actually don't even need to go to his class.

Professor Shiu has a passion and love for what he teaches and he whole heartedly cares about the well being of his students. He is very approachable and eager to help. I have a deep respect for this man and everything he does for his students. Memorization is key for this course, study off of his lecture slides and concentrate on the key terms.

This teacher makes me hate religion. I never hate religion that much in my life!! His lectures are boring and useless. I HOPE THAT I COULD DROP THIS CLASS. If you are hesitating about this class, my advice is that "DON'T TAKE IT!"
This course is not interesting and really boring. If you are sane, keep your sanity and don't choose this course. On a scale of 100, I give this course 1%.

You cannot learn anything and  teacher expects you to memorize everything. That is the only course where I find that the textbook is more interesting than lecture. However, it doesn't change the fact that the teacher and the textbook are boring. If you want to learn and do well in your life, don't choose this course. Sincere warning.

Very straight forward with material, and concepts are easy to understand. Very good with answering any questions you might have and if not sure of the answer will look it up and answer the following week. Expects you to study and put effort into the class, fair marker .
Material is easy to grasp and the professor is more then willing to answer any question you may have. Very kind man and an enjoyable class.
He's a great prof and is super approachable for help. He expects his students to work hard and earn their grades (as any good prof does). It was a pleasure taking his class.

I don't understand what some of these people are complaining about. It's a religions class so of course there is memorization and words that are in different languages. He gives you key terms to memorize for midterms and as long as you do that you'll do well. The essays are easy and he is very clear and straightforward. Overall it's pretty easy.

He gives out very harsh marks on the quizzes. He expects too much out of us, considering that it is a first year course and many of us don't have a religions background. Dreary professor with little to no interaction with the class. He speaks, we try to listen, but his accent is a big distraction. Don't take this course w/o a religions background!

I found the course pretty easy until the second quiz. The markings of the quizzes are unfair at times because the TAs mark fairly easy and the prof marks hard. Going to his lectures helps because he repeats a lot of stuff and it stays in your head. Readings are important. The final dropped my grade, which I didn't expect. Overall, he is okay.

not very interesting at all... quite boring class. very harsh marker with 2 test and 2 essays as the evaluation of the class. no textbook used. don't recommend it for anyone without any religious background
Excellent professor! Lectures are very well organized and he is very knowledgeable with the material.

He's a good teacher and explains well, but very boring. He speaks in monotone and is a hard marker. I love religions studies, but I constantly find myself drifting in class and can't listen to a full lecture without getting super bored or sleepy. Espeically because it's a 8am class.

Quite detail explanation, however, this class have quite lots of things to memorize, but just put some time on it it should be fine! You may feel boring but he really puts his heart in teaching, this is what I feel.
Harsh Marker. Materials are too challenging for students with no religious background.
Amazing Course & Professor ! Interesting, easy (with constant effort of course), and definitely worth your time! One of the best electives to take at UTSC.

HAD HIM FOR RLGA02 AS WELL, horrible prof!! SOOOO BORING!! you don't even have to go to lecture, but he marks essays unfair and his TA's suck. I suggest you take prof perley if your taking any religion courses!

Very boring lectures...barren lecture slides--not helpful for studying.  His introduction lectures are interesting/insightful.  His exams and quizzes are nothing but definitions and essays.  A lot of definitions to memorize for the final.  Textbook is not exactly helpful since i used the net and other texts to understand most terms.

Took his class in the summer expecting a hard class from previous posts. Actually turned out to be very straightforward. Simply create detailed study guides for the terms required to memorize and ask your TA for help on the essay... you should do fine. The prof knows his stuff, and some of what he says is quite interesting/insightful.

As long as you familiarize urself with his keyterms and attend classes (important for essay questions) you should do well. He is straight forward about what you are required to know (with the exception of a very few words not on keyword list) . Lectures were kinda boring but very insightful non the less, he does explain things VERY well.

I wanted to be enlightened instead I found that this course consists purely of memorization. Which means not only remembering words that are not even in english but a foreign language which sound very similar and are spelt simliar and on top of that have complicated philosophical meanings. NOW that is tough, lectures were also not-so-interesting.

exams are hard! in previous years exams were short answer questions but apparently the papers had been leaking around for a while so he changed the format and made it all defintions 5 marks each!alot are so simple and can barely be described in 1 line let alone 5! plus words are all hard to prononce/spell and remember being non english words.
An interesting course, but he's pretty boring and can be hard to understand at times.
Pretty easy class. Alot of memorization. Didn't go to a single lecture. Just memorize his powerpoints and you set.

Do not take this course. Extremly boring, reads from the slides. This course has ALOT of memorization and these words are NOT english! I did well on the final because i spent 2 weeks reading this book over and over again.

Soo boring. Exam questions were so stupid. No thought process involved. Marks papers like a grade 9 teacher. Don't bother attending the lecture cause he's too monotone and boring. You'll spend better time sleeping or reading the textbook. Take his course if you're good at memorizing ridiculously spelled words
He is so boring. Reads from the slides. No point in going to his lecture. Supposedly he his exams are basically the same as the old ones, if only I knew earlier.
very nice prof. Exam questions were word for word from the lecture slides. He's also teaching RLGA01, which should be the same questions as HUMB04.
